Ingredients.4: 0.25 cup heavy cream, plus more as needed

Ingredients.5: 1 cup shredded smoked Gouda cheese, or more to taste

Ingredients.13: 1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined

Ingredients.18: 1 dash hot pepper sauce, or to taste

Ingredients.19: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Prepare the grits: Bring chicken stock to a boil in a saucepan over high heat.

Directions.2: Slowly pour grits into stock while stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low; simmer until grits are tender and thick, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Directions.3: Stir in heavy cream to thin out the grits. Stir in Gouda cheese and butter until melted and smooth.

Directions.4: While grits are cooking, make the shrimp sauce: Place bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium heat; cook until bacon fat is rendered, about 3 minutes.

Directions.5: Stir in shallot and garlic; cooking and stirring until shallots are tender, about 5 minutes.

Directions.6: Pour in white wine and stir in butter, cooking and stirring until butter has melted.

Directions.7: Drop shrimp in the skillet; cook and stir until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is no longer transparent in the center, about 3 minutes.

Directions.8: Stir in spinach, mushrooms, and green onions; cook and stir until the spinach wilts, about 2 minutes more.

Directions.9: Remove shrimp with a slotted spoon.

Directions.10: Stir in heavy cream to the sauce. Simmer until the cream is reduced by about a third, about 10 minutes. Season with hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Return shrimp to the skillet to heat through.

Directions.11: Serve shrimp with sauce over the prepared grits.
